sections.markdown:
# Davis CoPilot
## DQL is super powerful, but what if we could use generative AI to do some of the hard work for us? Let's use Davis CoPilot to build the DQL for some common use cases
![](https://mkt-cdn.dynatrace.com/assets/Marketing/content-images/_1920x921_crop_center-center_100_line/davis-chart.png.webp)

### Investigate your logs for specific information

**Get a high level overview of your logs**

```Summarize all logs by log level```

**Convert logs into a time series**

```Show me all error logs this week with 15 minute intervals```

**Split by K8s Namespace over time**

```Show me the count of all error logs grouped by k8s namespace with a 5-minute interval```

davisCopilot.prompt: Summarize all logs by log level

data.dql:
fetch logs
| summarize by:{loglevel}, count = count()
data.prompt: Summarize all logs by log level

input.value:
fetch logs
| summarize by:{loglevel}, count = count()

grail.canonicalQuery:
fetch logs
| summarize by:{loglevel}, count = count()
grail.query:
fetch logs
| summarize by:{loglevel}, count = count()

input.value:
fetch logs
| summarize by:{loglevel}, count = count()

davisCopilot.prompt: Show me all error logs this week with 15 minute intervals

data.dql:
fetch logs, from:bin(now(), 7d)
| filter loglevel == "ERROR"
| makeTimeseries interval:15m, count = count()
data.prompt: Show me all error logs this week with 15 minute intervals

input.value:
fetch logs, from:bin(now(), 7d)
| filter loglevel == "ERROR"
| makeTimeseries interval:15m, count = count()

grail.canonicalQuery:
fetch logs, from:bin(now(), 7d)
| filter loglevel == "ERROR"
| makeTimeseries interval:15m, count = count()
grail.query:
fetch logs, from:bin(now(), 7d)
| filter loglevel == "ERROR"
| makeTimeseries interval:15m, count = count()

input.value:
fetch logs, from:bin(now(), 7d)
| filter loglevel == "ERROR"
| makeTimeseries interval:15m, count = count()

davisCopilot.prompt: Show me the count of ERROR logs grouped by k8s namespace with a 5-minute interval

data.dql:
fetch logs
| filter loglevel == "ERROR"
| makeTimeseries by:{k8s.namespace.name}, interval:5m, count = count()
data.prompt: Show me the count of ERROR logs grouped by k8s namespace with a 5-minute interval

input.value:
fetch logs
| filter loglevel == "ERROR"
| makeTimeseries by:{k8s.namespace.name}, interval:5m, count = count()

grail.canonicalQuery:
fetch logs
| filter loglevel == "ERROR"
| makeTimeseries by:{k8s.namespace.name}, interval:5m, count = count()
grail.query:
fetch logs
| filter loglevel == "ERROR"
| makeTimeseries by:{k8s.namespace.name}, interval:5m, count = count()

input.value:
fetch logs
| filter loglevel == "ERROR"
| makeTimeseries by:{k8s.namespace.name}, interval:5m, count = count()

sections.markdown:
### Understand application problems

**Get an overview of active and closed problems**

```Show all of today's problems by status with a 1 hour interval```

**Understand which entities are causing the most problems**

```From the problems in the last week, show me the most 10 most common root cause entities```

davisCopilot.prompt: Show all of today's problems by status with a 1 hour interval

data.dql:
fetch events, from:bin(now(), 1d)
| filter event.kind == "DAVIS_PROBLEM"
| makeTimeseries by:{status = event.status}, interval:1h, count = count()
data.prompt: Show all of today's problems by status with a 1 hour interval

input.value:
fetch events, from:bin(now(), 1d)
| filter event.kind == "DAVIS_PROBLEM"
| makeTimeseries by:{status = event.status}, interval:1h, count = count()

grail.canonicalQuery:
fetch events, from:bin(now(), 1d)
| filter event.kind == "DAVIS_PROBLEM"
| makeTimeseries by:{status = event.status}, interval:1h, count = count()
grail.query:
fetch events, from:bin(now(), 1d)
| filter event.kind == "DAVIS_PROBLEM"
| makeTimeseries by:{status = event.status}, interval:1h, count = count()

input.value:
fetch events, from:bin(now(), 1d)
| filter event.kind == "DAVIS_PROBLEM"
| makeTimeseries by:{status = event.status}, interval:1h, count = count()

davisCopilot.prompt: From the problems in the last week, show me the most 10 most common root cause entities

data.dql:
fetch events, from:now() - 7d
| filter isNotNull(root_cause_entity_id)
| summarize by:{root_cause_entity_id}, count = count()
| sort count desc
| limit 10
data.prompt: From the problems in the last week, show me the most 10 most common root cause entities

input.value:
fetch events, from:now() - 7d
| filter isNotNull(root_cause_entity_id)
| summarize by:{root_cause_entity_id}, count = count()
| sort count desc
| limit 10

grail.canonicalQuery:
fetch events, from:now() - 7d
| filter isNotNull(root_cause_entity_id)
| summarize by:{root_cause_entity_id}, count = count()
| sort count desc
| limit 10
grail.query:
fetch events, from:now() - 7d
| filter isNotNull(root_cause_entity_id)
| summarize by:{root_cause_entity_id}, count = count()
| sort count desc
| limit 10

input.value:
fetch events, from:now() - 7d
| filter isNotNull(root_cause_entity_id)
| summarize by:{root_cause_entity_id}, count = count()
| sort count desc
| limit 10

sections.markdown:
### Analyze resource utilization

**Understand if any hosts have CPU saturation**

```Show me the top 10 hosts by CPU Utilization```

**Understand if any hosts were over provisioned and should be sized down**

```Show me the top 10 hosts with the least CPU utilization```

davisCopilot.prompt: Show me the top 10 hosts by CPU Utilization

data.dql:
timeseries by:{dt.entity.host}, cpu_usage = avg(dt.host.cpu.usage)
| fieldsAdd avg_cpu_usage = arrayAvg(cpu_usage)
| sort avg_cpu_usage desc
| limit 10
data.prompt: Show me the top 10 hosts by CPU Utilization

input.value:
timeseries by:{dt.entity.host}, cpu_usage = avg(dt.host.cpu.usage)
| fieldsAdd avg_cpu_usage = arrayAvg(cpu_usage)
| sort avg_cpu_usage desc
| limit 10

grail.canonicalQuery:
timeseries by:{dt.entity.host}, cpu_usage = avg(dt.host.cpu.usage)
| fieldsAdd avg_cpu_usage = arrayAvg(cpu_usage)
| sort avg_cpu_usage desc
| limit 10
grail.query:
timeseries by:{dt.entity.host}, cpu_usage = avg(dt.host.cpu.usage)
| fieldsAdd avg_cpu_usage = arrayAvg(cpu_usage)
| sort avg_cpu_usage desc
| limit 10

metrics.description: Percentage of CPU time when CPU was utilized. A value close to 100% means most host processing resources are in use, and host CPUs canâ€™t handle additional work

input.value:
timeseries by:{dt.entity.host}, cpu_usage = avg(dt.host.cpu.usage)
| fieldsAdd avg_cpu_usage = arrayAvg(cpu_usage)
| sort avg_cpu_usage desc
| limit 10

davisCopilot.prompt: Show me the top 10 hosts with the least CPU utilization

data.dql:
timeseries by:{dt.entity.host}, cpu = avg(dt.host.cpu.usage)
| fieldsAdd avg_cpu = arrayAvg(cpu)
| sort avg_cpu asc
| limit 10
data.prompt: Show me the top 10 hosts with the least CPU utilization

input.value:
timeseries by:{dt.entity.host}, cpu = avg(dt.host.cpu.usage)
| fieldsAdd avg_cpu = arrayAvg(cpu)
| sort avg_cpu asc
| limit 10

grail.canonicalQuery:
timeseries by:{dt.entity.host}, cpu = avg(dt.host.cpu.usage)
| fieldsAdd avg_cpu = arrayAvg(cpu)
| sort avg_cpu
| limit 10
grail.query:
timeseries by:{dt.entity.host}, cpu = avg(dt.host.cpu.usage)
| fieldsAdd avg_cpu = arrayAvg(cpu)
| sort avg_cpu asc
| limit 10

metrics.description: Percentage of CPU time when CPU was utilized. A value close to 100% means most host processing resources are in use, and host CPUs canâ€™t handle additional work

input.value:
timeseries by:{dt.entity.host}, cpu = avg(dt.host.cpu.usage)
| fieldsAdd avg_cpu = arrayAvg(cpu)
| sort avg_cpu asc
| limit 10

sections.markdown:
### Investigate security issues

**Understand which services have a high CVE score**

```Show all process names with a CVE score of 7 and above and remove all other fields```

davisCopilot.prompt: Show all process names with a CVE score of 7 and above and remove all other fields

data.dql:
fetch events
| filter vulnerability.cvss.base_score >= 7
| fieldsKeep affected_entity.affected_processes.names
data.prompt: Show all process names with a CVE score of 7 and above and remove all other fields

input.value:
fetch events
| filter vulnerability.cvss.base_score >= 7
| fieldsKeep affected_entity.affected_processes.names

grail.canonicalQuery:
fetch events
| filter vulnerability.cvss.base_score >= 7
| fieldsKeep affected_entity.affected_processes.names
grail.query:
fetch events
| filter vulnerability.cvss.base_score >= 7
| fieldsKeep affected_entity.affected_processes.names

notifications.messageFormat: Your result has been limited to %1$s.
notifications.message: Your result has been limited to 1000.
Your result has been limited to 1000.

input.value:
fetch events
| filter vulnerability.cvss.base_score >= 7
| fieldsKeep affected_entity.affected_processes.names

sections.markdown:
### Run deep analytics on business events

**Query specific business event data and convert to a timeseries**

```Show me the sum of "amount" for all business events of type "com.easytrade.deposit" in one hour intervals and call the output "deposits" over the last week```

davisCopilot.prompt: Show me the sum of "amount" for all business events of type "com.easytrade.deposit" in one hour intervals and call the output "deposits" over the last week

data.dql:
fetch bizevents, from:now() - 7d, to:now()
| filter event.type == "com.easytrade.deposit"
| makeTimeseries interval:1h, deposits = sum(toDouble(amount))
data.prompt: Show me the sum of "amount" for all business events of type "com.easytrade.deposit" in one hour intervals and call the output "deposits" over the last week

input.value:
fetch bizevents, from:now() - 7d, to:now()
| filter event.type == "com.easytrade.deposit"
| makeTimeseries interval:1h, deposits = sum(toDouble(amount))

grail.canonicalQuery:
fetch bizevents, from:now() - 7d, to:now()
| filter event.type == "com.easytrade.deposit"
| makeTimeseries interval:1h, deposits = sum(toDouble(amount))
grail.query:
fetch bizevents, from:now() - 7d, to:now()
| filter event.type == "com.easytrade.deposit"
| makeTimeseries interval:1h, deposits = sum(toDouble(amount))

input.value:
fetch bizevents, from:now() - 7d, to:now()
| filter event.type == "com.easytrade.deposit"
| makeTimeseries interval:1h, deposits = sum(toDouble(amount))
